exercises.setup_notes: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
exercises.execution_notes: Bend and extend the elbows while keeping the arms overhead. Ensure the cable provides tension throughout the range of motion.
exercises.tier_reasons: Provides high tension in the stretched position, feels good, and allows for simple progression. Validated by a 2023 study showing 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to the overhead position providing a deep stretch.
exercises.scientific_insights: 2023 study found overhead extensions caused about 40% more triceps growth than press downs.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is ideal for beginners as it provides a high tension in the stretched position, which is crucial for triceps growth, especially for the long head. It aligns with the user's goal of thicker triceps and is simple to progress with, making it suitable for someone with less than 3 months of experience.

exercises.setup_notes: Use an EZ bar or straight bar. Lie on a bench with the bar overhead.
exercises.execution_notes: Lower the bar behind the head to increase stretch, then extend the elbows to lift the bar back up.
exercises.tier_reasons: High tension in stretched position, feels good with EZ bar, and allows for simple progression.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to the stretch when lowering the bar behind the head.
exercises.selection_reason: Skull Crushers are effective for targeting the long head of the triceps, providing a deep stretch that is beneficial for muscle growth. This exercise is suitable for beginners as it allows for simple progression and can be performed with an EZ bar, which is easier on the wrists.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to the sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Make small circles with your arms, gradually increasing the size. Reverse the direction halfway through.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand or sit, raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Use the opposite hand to gently push the elbow back, stretching the triceps. Hold and switch sides.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed by your sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Roll your shoulders forward in a circular motion, then reverse the direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended in front.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing your arms back and forth across your chest, alternating the top arm.
